Within PhysLean, I am working on quantum mechanics and am trying to formalize results related to rigged Hilbert spaces. In particular, in 1d I need the following continuous linear equivalence 

import Mathlib

-- SchwartzMap.toLpCLM ℂ ℂ 2 MeasureTheory.volume
-- is a injective continuous linear map with domain `SchwartzMap ℝ ℂ`.

def schwartzSubmoduleEquiv :
  LinearMap.range (SchwartzMap.toLpCLM ℂ (E := ℝ) ℂ 2 MeasureTheory.volume)
  ≃L[ℂ] SchwartzMap ℝ ℂ  := by sorry

That is the continuous linear equivalence between the sub-module of AE equal equivalence classes of square-integrable functions that can be represented by Schwartz maps and the module of Schwartz maps itself.

Defining this equivalence as a linear equivalence is somewhat easy, with the forward direction relying on choice. But I'm struggling to define it as a continuous equivalence. Is there any code in mathlib that would allow this to be done?

(This follows from this post on the PhysLean channel).
Joseph Tooby-Smith has marked this topic as resolved.
